result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Neng Vang

records.addlTxt: Check returned - not deliverable as addressed - unable to forward.
Processed Financial Request Form

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 3:06 pm 
INCLUDES 17CF503, 15CF1165, AND 15CF869. 
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo; Def appears in person, in custody with Atty Suzanne O'Neill.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW. 
Interpreter sworn. 

State moves to: 
In 17CF503: Ct. 3 (Felony BJ)>>AMEND to Misd. BJ pursuant to 946.49(1)(a). 
                    : Ct. 4 (Battery/DA)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 6 (Felony BJ)>>AMEND to Misd. BJ pursuant to 946.49(1)(a). 
                    : Ct. 7 (Felony BJ)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 8 (Intimidate Victim - Threaten Force, etc./DA)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 9 (Battery/DA)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 11 (Felony BJ)>>AMEND to Misd. BJ pursuant to 946.49(1)(a). 
                    : Ct. 12 (Felony BJ)>>D&RI. 
In 15CF1165: Ct. 1 (Felony BJ)>>D&RI. 
                      : Ct. 2 (Unlawful Phone Use - Threatens Harm)>>D&RI. 
In 15CF869: Ct. 1 (Child Abuse - Recklessly Cause Great Harm)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: 
In 17CF503: Ct. 1 (Threats to Injure - Accuse of Crime/DA)>>NO CONTEST. 
                    : Ct. 2 (Felony BJ)>>NO CONTEST. 
                    :  Amended Ct. 3 (Misd. BJ)>>NO CONTEST. 
                    : Ct. 5 (DC/DA)>>NO CONTEST. 
                    : Amended Ct. 6 (Misd. BJ)>>NO CONTEST. 
                    : Ct. 10 (DC/DA)>>NO CONTEST. 
                    : Amended Ct. 11 (Misd. BJ)>>NO CONTEST. 
COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding. 
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, def guilty of Cts. 3, 5, 6, 10, & 11, but defers entry of judgment on Cts. 1 & 2. 
Def makes statement. 

COURT ORDERS: 
In 17CF503: Ct. 1>>DEOJ for 3 years and 9 months with conditions as outlined in written agreement - if def completes agreement successfully, State will move to Dismiss this charge. 
                    : Ct. 2>>DEOJ for 3 years and 9 months with conditions as outlined in written agreement - if def completes agreement successfully, State will move to Dismiss this charge. 
                    : Ct. 3>>228 days MCJ with 228 days credit for time served. 
                    : Ct. 5, 6, 10, & 11>>SWH for 3 years probation - CONDITIONS: 30 days MCJ imposed and STAYED; 30 hours CS imposed and STAYED; assessment/treatment/counseling as required by agent; SAFE program intake and follow through with any treatment recommendations; good faith effort to maintain fulltime employment/school/combination of the 2; no contact with M.H. unless approved by agent; no contact with People's State Bank or Oak View Professional Building; DNA sample/surcharges; CC including 2 DA surcharges. 
All sentences are CONCURRENT. 

DEOJ review set for Sept 10, 2021 at 1:10 pm in the DA's Office in 17CF503. 
Probation Review Hearing set for March 9, 2018 at 1:15 pm in Br. 1 in 17CF503 - def has right to have attorney present at that time. 
Adj: 4:04 pm 

cc: Shirley re: interpreter
